CIPHER.1212.cipherString: Those who do not absorb the vivid symbols of night glowing on the canvas above will never fly with lustrous wings.
CIPHER.1212.question: Decode this quote from a journal that was provided to you in a puzzle game by PostCurious.

CIPHER.1214.cipherString: Guided by the light of the moon and a few wrong turns, I walked into a clearing and there it was: The Temple of the Birds.
CIPHER.1214.question: This quote is from an escape game by the Society of Curiosities. It has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.

CIPHER.1213.cipherString: Come back, cowards! Everyone knows Merfolk can‚Äôt wield magic!
CIPHER.1213.question: The last words of Pashadar Dirf in Magic: the Gathering lore were encoded with the Porta Cipher using a keyword of TRAGEDY. What do they say?

CIPHER.1215.cipherString: chop away at her long silky strands
CIPHER.1215.question: Decode the following quote from a PostCurious puzzle game which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of LUSH.

CIPHER.1216.cipherString: Members of the academically focused Cascade Bearers are dedicated to the advancement of magical theory.
CIPHER.1216.question: A quote from a fantasy RPG setting has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.

CIPHER.1217.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 7028 16985. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.1218.cipherString: When you‚Äôve got the temperament of a dragon, every argument is one you‚Äôll win.
CIPHER.1218.question: The following quote from a Magic: the Gathering card needs to be decoded using the Porta Cipher with a keyword of FIERY.

CIPHER.1219.cipherString: Amazing thing, gravity. It seems to work every time.
CIPHER.1219.question: The following quote by Telim'Tor on a Magic: the Gathering card needs to be decoded. It was encoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of RAZOR and polybius key of IMPRESSIVE.

CIPHER.1220.cipherString: Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again.
CIPHER.1220.question: A quote by Karn on a Magic: the Gathering card has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher. What was the K2 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.1220.author: Karn

CIPHER.1221.question: Solve this quote that has been encoded using the Cryptarithm Cipher. What do the values 793695 320183 decode to? [Editor's Note: This problem turned out more difficult than anticipated.]

CIPHER.1222.cipherString: Sadly this church was locked and I couldn't go in but it had a beautiful garden where I sat and sketched.
CIPHER.1222.question: This quote is from a character's journal in the Society of Curiosities escape game. It has been encoded as a random Aristocrat - what does it say?

CIPHER.1224.cipherString: leap aside as a spectral schoolbus pulls up ahead

CIPHER.1225.cipherString: lid from a blue ceramic dish
CIPHER.1225.question: Decode the following quote from a puzzle game which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of BLIP.

CIPHER.1226.cipherString: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.
CIPHER.1226.question: A quote from a Magic: the Gathering card has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has ALREADY somewhere in it.

CIPHER.1227.cipherString: We have access to the best medical researchers in the industry, trust us, we‚Äôve made sure of that.
CIPHER.1227.question: Here's a K1 Patristocrat from the brochure of the bio-research company Veritas Industries (a division of Glitch Games). You are told that URGQ decodes to BEST. What does it say?

CIPHER.1228.cipherString: People love to follow fools; they don't feel so alone then.

You are told that the quote has ALONE in it corresponding to the encoded text G I B O H C, meaning B = ‚óè√ó‚Äì; C = ‚óè√ó√ó; G = ‚óè‚Äì√ó; H = ‚Äì‚óè√ó; I = ‚óè‚Äì‚óè; O = ‚Äì‚Äì√ó.

CIPHER.1229.cipherString: There are always people about at the excavation site and finding solitude today is key to my happiness.
CIPHER.1229.question: This quote is a snippet of a character's journal in an escape game by the Society of Curiosities. It was encoded as a K3 Aristocrat, with the character's surname as the keyword. It's not in the dictionary, but I'm confident that you can recover it with the information I've given you. Good luck!

CIPHER.1230.cipherString: Beware both the trickery of others and the ways in which you may be deceiving yourself.
CIPHER.1230.question: Here's some advice from a PostCurious puzzle game, encoded as a Complete Columnar cipher. You are told that the quote contains OTHERSAND.

CIPHER.1231.cipherString: We have pushed boundaries in every area of science imaginable. There is no line we won‚Äôt cross in our relentless pursuit of knowledge.
CIPHER.1231.question: This quote is from a brochure you found for the bio-research company Veritas Industries (a division of Glitch Games). It has been encoded as a random Aristocrat for secrecy. What does it say?

CIPHER.1232.cipherString: something he had just freshly discovered ‚Äúout of spite"

CIPHER.1234.cipherString: Transform abstract notions into real action

CIPHER.1235.cipherString: Drifting from sleep onto the forest floor, I stare upward at thousand-year-old artifacts and hear the leaves whisper of the spirit of the woods.
CIPHER.1235.question: This is a snippet of a poem in a PostCurious game, encoded as a random Aristocrat. What does it say?
CIPHER.1235.author: hard

CIPHER.1236.cipherString: conserve what is truly precious to you
CIPHER.1236.question: The following quote from a PostCurious puzzle game needs to be decoded. It was encoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a polybius key of RELINQUISHING and keyword of CONTROL.

CIPHER.1237.cipherString: In side each uv us iz a well of perseverence who's depths wee olny come two understand in extreem circumstantces.
CIPHER.1237.question: This quote from PostCurious' ‚ÄúLight in the Mist‚Äù has been misspelled, mistyped, and misheard. The best thing about it is that it's encoded as a K1 Aristocrat. One of the long words is spelled properly! And about half of the tiny words are correct.

CIPHER.1240.cipherString: There are also four satchels containing artifacts that correspond to each of the envelopes.
CIPHER.1240.question: Solve this K2 Patristocrat cipher. It comes from a game by PostCurious. It might be helpful at some point to know that this quote is about a couple of different kinds of containers.

CIPHER.1241.cipherString: After one eternity the stars grew tired, bored and unhappy of simply playing amongst themselves.
CIPHER.1241.question: This is part of a legend retold in a PostCurious game, and it has been encoded as a K1 Aristocrat cipher. What was the keyword used to encode it?
